page.title: 19FENSTANTON ROADS
page.content: { }Today the{Low Road}is often used when going to{St Ives.}Whilst this route is that of an ancient bridle way it was not until Enclosures Act of 1810 it{officially}became a road for its full length. Now the{Low Road}is well used, but{very bumpy}and{quite dangerous} because it{floods badly}and{ices badly in{winter. { }The Romans built a{military road} from{Godmanchester}starting with a good solid foundation.It is the{old {A604 that runs though Fenstanton.}Now {Fenstanton is by-passed with a bridge. It has only been finished about 3 or 4 years. The new route to St Ives is a lot longer than the old one.{ { }Now Fenstanton people have got easy access to the{A1 and the M11 {via the A604.
